channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in NZ and around the world on 23 May
item.description: Today's Covid-19 developments include news about a New Zealand vaccine venture, a lauded celebrity cat, problems getting shearing gangs, and a warning against Trump's favoured medicine of choice.

item.title: NZ govt concerned over China's security law for Hong Kong
item.description: The New Zealand government has joined a chorus of international concern about China's plan to impose a national security law on Hong Kong.

item.title: How have the elderly fared during lockdown?
item.description: Loneliness has plagued some, but many elderly people have coped "remarkably well" during the pandemic lockdown, says doctor and author Doug Wilson.

item.title: Heavy rain forecast for most of NZ on Sunday and Monday
item.description: Heavy rain is expected in central New Zealand from tomorrow afternoon and most will see rain on Monday.

item.title: Kiwi company 'cautiously optimistic' on developing Covid-19 vaccine
item.description: A New Zealand company says it's early days, but it's cautiously optimistic about its chances of developing a Covid-19 vaccine.

item.title: No new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today
item.description: There have been no new cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand today, the Health Ministry has confirmed.

item.title: Search expands as two weeks passes since trampers entered park
item.description: A Defence Force helicopter is back in the air searching for two trampers missing in Kahurangi National Park, but bad weather is on the way.

item.title: Meth importation ring run from prison
item.description: A man who ran a meth-importation ring from behind bars - involving nearly $300,000 of the drug - has been jailed for six and a-half years.

item.title: Search on for young woman missing in Hunua Ranges
item.description: A search and rescue team is scouring the Hunua Ranges south of Auckland city for a missing 25-year-old woman.

item.title: Oamaru teen arsonist had psychosis, court hears
item.description: An Oamaru youth asked his mother for cannabis and a petrol can before deliberately lighting two gas bottles, setting his house ablaze, a court heard this week.

item.title: Wellington celebrity cat Mittens awarded honor by mayor
item.description: Wellington's mayor has awarded the Key to the City to a celebrity inner city cat.

item.title: KakÄ« population soars under predator control
item.description: The world's rarest wading bird is coming back from the brink of extinction.

item.title: Reflections II: Lockdown 'slowly ate away at my soul'
item.description: After seven weeks away, students flooded back through their school gates on Monday morning - eager for a return to normality.

item.title: Police seek witnesses to Wairarapa hit and run
item.description: Police are seeking witnesses to a hit and run in Wairarapa early yesterday morning.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened around NZ and the world on 22 May
item.description: Simon Bridges has become a Covid-19 political casualty; 43,000 people have gone onto the Jobseeker Support benefit; and retail spending has its worst quarterly drop in eight years.

item.title: Two die in Palmerston North crash
item.description: Two people have died after a serious crash between two cars in Palmerston North overnight.

item.title: New Christchurch Hospital building 'not fit for purpose' - board member
item.description: Having a "train wreck" of a building at Christchurch hospital will be on government ministers' heads if they accept the DHB's decision, a dissenting board member says.

item.title: Rotorua mayoral, chief exec offices undergoing $1.7 million renovation
item.description: Some councillors say the roughly $1.7 million in renovations is not a good look when people are struggling, but the mayor says ceiling tiles have fallen on her desk.
